author: sina_mobile
title: OpenAI年化收入达120亿美元，ChatGPT周活跃用户达7亿_手机新浪网
text:
OpenAI年化收入达120亿美元，ChatGPT周活跃用户达7亿
（来源：三言科技）
7月31日，据The Information报道，OpenAI在2025年前七个月实现收入翻番，年化收入达到120亿美元，相比2024年约40亿美元的收入水平大幅增长，有望超越其2025年127亿美元的收入预期。目前OpenAI月收入约为10亿美元，相比年初的约5亿美元跃升，主要驱动力来自更多企业和个人订阅其聊天机器人服务。用户增长是收入上升的关键因素，ChatGPT目前拥有约7亿周活跃用户，涵盖消费者和企业客户，相比3月底OpenAI所有产品5亿周活跃用户的数据显著增长。
与此同时，OpenAI的现金消耗也在加速，已将2025年现金消耗预期上调至约80亿美元，较此前预期增加10亿美元，可能上调此前预计的2025年140亿美元服务器租赁支出。在融资方面，OpenAI正接近完成第二轮75亿美元融资的承诺，现有股东红杉资本和Tiger Global Management等将各自投入数亿美元，其他参与方包括Dragoneer和Founders Fund等知名投资机构。此外，OpenAI和软银;)还承诺各投资180亿美元建立数据中心合资企业。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->computing and information technology
Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Arsenal missed the chance to return to the top of the Premier League as it slipped to a disappointing defeat to West Ham amid more VAR controversy.
title: Arsenal misses chance to return to summit | beIN SPORTS
text:
Arsenal misses chance to return to summit Arsenal missed the chance to return to the top of the Premier League as it slipped to a disappointing defeat to West Ham amid more VAR controversy. Watch a full match replay, via Arsenal TV, on beIN SPORTS at 5.30pm AEDT | 7.30pm NZDT | Sign up for beIN SPORTS CONNECT to take advantage of our 7-day free trial | AUS | NZ
The Gunners needed victory to replace Liverpool at the summit but lost 2-0 on a night where Hammers boss David Moyes finally landed a victory at the Emirates Stadium.
West Ham lost Kurt Zouma ahead of the game and Lucas Paqueta after just over half an hour but hit the front through Tomas Soucek’s strike, awarded after VAR could not determine whether the whole ball had gone out of play in the build-up.
A second-half header from former Arsenal defender Konstantinos Mavropanos secured the points and things could have been even better for the visitors had Said Benrahma not seen a last-gasp penalty saved by David Raya.
Moyes had failed to secure victory in his previous 72 Premier League away games at Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool or Manchester United, so this was a long time coming for the Scot.
Arsenal laboured when they needed to continue their recent winning run in London derbies to go back to the top of the table.
Instead, only captain Martin Odegaard could hold his head high on a night where their defence creaked and Gabriel Jesus was guilty of missing a couple of very good chances.
Arsenal started well, with some great touches in and around the West Ham box from Odegaard in particular.
But at the other end their defending left a lot to be desired, as Oleksandr Zinchenko and Gabriel Magalhaes failed to deal with a simple ball into the middle.
Jarrod Bowen capitalised by latching onto the miscue and teed up Soucek to finish – the goal surviving a lengthy VAR check which could not ultimately make a call on if the ball had not gone out of play before Bowen’s cutback.
Arsenal looked to respond although the goal gave West Ham something to defend, although Jesus found a way in behind with a subtle flick into Bukayo Saka, whose header was brilliantly saved by Alphonse Areola.
Paqueta had been hurt in the warm-up and lasted just over half an hour, with his fellow Brazilian Gabriel Martinelli curling an effort just wide for Arsenal as they continued in vain to find a leveller.
The hosts were getting closer, West Ham gifting possession as two passes saw Arsenal in on goal once more, this time Saka hitting the base of the post from an acute angle.
Former West Ham captain Declan Rice fired just over from 25 yards but it was another player coming back to haunt his former club who would find the back of the net soon after.
Mavropanos made just seven league starts in three years as an Arsenal player but returned to the Premier League last summer with the Hammers and headed them two goals ahead before the hour.
Jesus then headed straight at Areola before sending another fine chance well over the bar moments after Arteta introduced Eddie Nketiah and Reiss Nelson off the bench.
Areola was on hand again to keep out a Leandro Trossard effort, with Vladimir Coufal clearing a William Saliba header off the line from the resulting corner.
Rice had come off the bench during a 3-0 Carabao Cup defeat on his return to West Ham earlier in the season and endured another night to forget here as he conceded a late penalty for tripping Emerson Palmieri in the box – only for Raya to keep out substitute Benrahma’s tame spot-kick.

author: Big Country News
title: Avista's My Energy Discount Program: A Helping Hand for Washington Residents - NewsBreak
text:
Whitman County, Washington
Avista’s My Energy Discount Program: A Helping Hand for Washington Residents
2 hours ago
SPOKANE - As costs all around us continue to rise, many residents are feeling the pinch. If you’re looking for ways to keep your energy costs lower, Avista may be able to help. The company’s My Energy Discount Program is available to nearly one in three Washington customers. Even with more than 40% of eligible customers already participating, Avista says over 89,000 additional households have yet to sign up.
2

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text:
A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her.
The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected.
According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement.
Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up.
Treatment called 'inconceivable' Gypsy Rose Blanchard released from Missouri prison early Thursday morning, DOC confirms Cher files for conservatorship of her son, claims Elijah Blue Allman's life is 'at risk' Ex-boyfriend of missing St. Louis woman admits to her murder after Wisconsin arrest: Police 6 dead, 3 injured in Johnson County, Texas, crash; victims include 2 young kids ages 9, 10 California Pizza Huts lay off all delivery drivers ahead of minimum wage increase “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit.
Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment.
"[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.”
Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.
The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg.
“Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote.
Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages.
Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: Findeton
title: #25 Rusia condena la "represión rutinaria" de los disidentes por parte de los estados de la UE [rt]
text:
[Elbaronrojo](/user/Elbaronrojo)a [rt.com](/go/link/3967324) [#10](c10#c-10) allí las buenas familias se lo repartieron todo. Como aquí.
Ningún asesino fascista o colaborador pagó por sus crímenes
Tenemos un rey.
La ley de secretos oficiales es un armario lleno de fantasmas podridos.
La dueña del estado, la iglesia de roma, ha violado niños por miles, los ha robado por decenas de miles para entregarlos, previo pago, a las buenas familias del párrafo uno. Es machista, homófoba, y racista.
No paga impuestos y su mera palabra basta para auto inscribir a su nombre propiedades del patrimonio nacional.
Educa al 86% de los niños del país, y redacta el 100% de los libros de texto.
Puedo seguir.
Europa es un asco, con 18 conflictos bélicos abiertos,y uno de los más grandes vendedores de armas.
En poder destructivo activo, hoy, rusia es un enano a su lado.
Y así hasta el infinito.
Insisto en lo que dije: vale que Rusia mierda.
Pero no vale decirlo desde el ejemplo de la Europa cristiana.
[#2](c2#c-2) Desde luego si hay que cercenar la libertad de expresión que sea judicialmente y no con té de polonio. Mejor aburrirse hasta volverse loco a lo Assange que visitar la acera de abajo a demasiada velocidad. El mejor de los mundos posibles.
[#2](c2#c-2) Cuidao con lo del dedo y la luna. Vale que Rusia es una oligarquía ultraortodoxa chunga, pero europa da un ascazo atroz.
¿Si hacemos un ránking tienes muy claro, muy claro, muy claro que Rusia es peor?
Empate de manual en mierdismo.
[#19](c19#c-19) No. Aprovecho la enésima mierda para llamar la atención sobre una realidad sangrante.
Nos pasamos la vida mordiendo todas las putas zanahorias que nos ponen, y tenemos a nuestro peor enemigo en casa, dentro de la camisa.
[#20](c20#c-20) la realidad que te inventas , repito, vete a pasarte una temporada rusia para poder comparar y llévate una bandera de ucrania
[#21](c21#c-21) Que está muy bien pasarse la vida hablando de Rusia, hombre, mientras en casa vivimos una democracia plena, igualitaria, justa y sana, en la que ningún criminal campa a sus anchas y todo se hace siguiendo estrictos cánones de fair play...
Que la que yo me invento es una mierda, pero de la que tú te evades, colega, no te la envidio nadita...
[#4](c4#c-4) El que Rusia sea una oligarquia y carezca de democracia no quita que la UE sea una dictadura neoliberal... que se lo digan a Yaris Varoufakis cuando en 2015 le dijeron en la UE los ministros de economia que las elecciones en europa no estan para cambiar el modelo economico... o neoliberalismo o neoliberalismo...
[#15](c15#c-15) Oh, Varoufakis se queja de que cuando PIDE prestado a la UE a una tasa de interés mucho más baja que la del libre mercado, los prestamistas ponen condiciones. ¡Dictaduraaaaaa! ¡Neoliberallll!
Ante el vicio de pedir está la virtud de no dar.
[#1](c1#c-1) La dictadura rusa no tiene ninguna credibilidad. Por mucho que los putinejos te voten positivo.
En Rusia a los opositores los tiran por la ventana, directamente.

author: Chloe Godding
title: Osawatomie toddler hospitalized after ingesting 'unknown amount' of meth, police say
text:
2-year-old in critical condition after apparent methamphetamine overdose, Kansas police say; woman charged
A 2-year-old girl was taken to the hospital in critical condition after ingesting an unknown amount of methamphetamine, according to the Osawatomie, Kansas, Police Department.
Police said that they responded to a residence at 520 Pacific Ave. at 11:58 p.m. Tuesday on a report that a 2-year-old was in medical distress. While on their way, officers were told the girl was having a seizure due to ingesting meth.
When they arrived, they found her in critical condition. She was rushed to Children's Mercy Hospital by Miami County EMS.
A search warrant uncovered marijuana, marijuana paraphernalia and meth paraphernalia at the residence.
Investigators learned that the girl's biological mom allegedly did not request medical attention for her child out of fear of getting in trouble. The mom allegedly destroyed evidence regarding the meth overdose, police said. A grandparent alerted police what had happened.
Jacci Marie Hays, 34, was arrested Wednesday, April 9, and faces charges of aggravated child endangerment, possession of drug paraphernalia, possession of marijuana and interference with law enforcement by destroying evidence.
"As a community, I would ask that you keep the two year old child and the first responders that worked this case in your thoughts and prayers," Osawatomie Police Chief David Stuteville said in a news release. "Cases like these take a toll on everyone involved."
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes
